title: Feature request - Set tag element of component without using a prop
body: **Do you want to request a *feature* or report a *bug*?** Feature I think it would be useful to have the ability to set the containing element tag of a component using some syntactic flag (not a prop) because the tag isn't really the data of a component, which is what a prop is for. **What is the current behavior?** Currently there are two options I'm aware of setting the containing tag element ### Option 1 Set the tag as a prop when calling the component. ```.jsx const MyButtonComponent = props => { const Tag = props.tag ? props.tag : 'button'; return { props.children } } I'm a button I'm an anchor link ``` ### Option 2 Render a `` at the root of the child and render the container element from the parent. ```.jsx const MyButtonComponent = props => { return { props.children } } I'm an anchor link ``` For both options, the result would be: ```.html I'm an anchor link ``` Both work, but I feel like if we can infer the props.children from whatever is inbetween the component tags, why not provide some more syntactic sugar for setting the tag element as well? **What is the expected behavior?** I think something like `Content` might be nice. So the previous examples would instead be written as follows: ```.jsx I'm a button I'm an anchor link ``` I feel this syntax adequately describes what's happening, but is terse enough that you don't end up having to create additional nodes or pass props to components. I believe props should be reserved for the **data** of the component. Using them to set the tag seems hacky to me. **Which versions of React, and which browser / OS are affected by this issue? Did this work in previous versions of React?** N/A
